Zar's Holiday Bash!
Mini-Game 1632 by Zar
Reviewed by: Faraday, Nexus, Vi



OMAGERD You have been invited to Zar's Holiday Bash! Isn't that exciting? You've waited for that card ever since Zar set foot in mafiascum! Unfortunately, turns out you had no idea people would literally kill to be there. And that's exactly what's been happening. Impostors murdered and are impersonating some of the real guests, and they're most definitely not good people. They're set to eliminate Zar, his Westerosi case-building ways, and those that support him! Sadly Zar's way too busy hosting his party to bother double checking everyone's ID's... I mean, come on, there are 5 thousand guests and a handful of events taking place! However, he has given word that he will look at the documents (one person at a time) that are brought to him. His co-host and reviewers have narrowed down the suspect pool to the sketchiest 13 guests. Sadly, you're among them.

As a precautionary measure, the thirteen of you have been locked in one of the wings of the castle (yep, the same one from 160B). Everyone is certainly convinced the impostors are among you since, aside from flings no one wants to know about, no crimes have happened after you all were locked up together. We think that letting you sort it out should work? Hopefully those impostors won't end up killing everyone in the room and the house! Work your wits to catch them and try to make at least to the final dinner!


This is the sample Vanilla Townie role PM


Welcome, [Player X]! You are a Vanilla Townie.

During the day you have the ability to post in the game thread and vote.

You win when all threats to the Town have been eliminated and at least one member of the town is still alive.

Please confirm by sending your role to me via PM.

RULE SET (stolen Borrowed with Permission from Lost Butterfly since Mini 1382)

A) Ethics and Sportsmanship

A1) All sitewide rules apply. Read them here
A2) Play to your faction's win condition, as long as you do not break any game or site rules in doing so.
A3) You may not discuss this game anywhere outside the game thread unless explicitly permitted to do so in your role PM.
A4) Quoting or pretending to quote your role PM, quicktopics, private communications with the mod, or (in the case of hydrae) discussion with other heads is strictly forbidden. Loose paraphrasing is permitted, although run it past me first when in doubt.
A5) Be civil and treat other players with respect--attack the case, not the person. Mafia is a heated game, but I will interfere if anyone resorts to excessive insults, personal attacks, and bullying.
A6) There is a zero-tolerance policy against offensive comments or slurs based on race, gender, religion, ethnicity, sexual orientation, etc. You may be harshly punished for even a first violation of this rule.
A7) Encryption is forbidden, as well as messages hidden in invisible text, small text, or BBCode tags. Always err on the side of caution and ask the mod before leaving a code or breadcrumb. A good rule of thumb is that if the average person cannot decipher the code without outside software after having it pointed out, you can't use it.
A8) Editing and deleting posts (if you have the power to do so) is strictly forbidden.
A9) If you have outside information that influences your knowledge of the game, are aware of someone else having outside information, or have any reason to believe that the game has been compromised, it is your responsibility to inform the mod immediately. I will love you for your honesty.

B) Voting/Lynching Mechanics

B1) For your vote or unvote to be counted, it must be completely bolded, and use the format Vote: PlayerName/Unvote: PlayerName or VOTE: Playername/UNVOTE: Playername (capital letters and colon optional). Any other variation (such Hammer: PlayerName) will not be counted.
B2) Votes for misspellings or acronyms of players' names (such as VOTE: Playrname or VOTE: PN) are valid as long as the player being voted for is clear. You are not required to unvote before changing your vote. However, votes that are behind spoiler tags, in small or invisible text, or otherwise concealed are invalid.
B3) A lynch will occur when 50%+1 of the votes are cast for the same player. When this has happened, any subsequent votes and unvotes will not be counted, and the game will enter twilight.
B4) (AKA Zachrulez's Nemesis's Rule) You may vote for "no lynch" if you wish. If 50% of the players in the game vote for no-lynch, the game will progress to night without a lynch.
B5) Dead is dead - no 'Bah' post. Not even one. If the mod hasn't posted the endgame scene, you may not post again, even after a hammer in LYLO. Under absolutely under no circumstances may you reveal game-relevant information after your death.
B6) (AKA The "Blame Katsuki" Rule) Votes from an alt account will be interpreted in the most damaging way to your faction. If you can't log in correctly, you have little to complain about.

C) Activity and Deadlines

C1) Days will be 2 weeks long.
C2) Deadlines will not be extended barring exceptional circumstances or replacement situations. If a majority lynch is not reached before deadline, no lynch occurs.
C3) You may continue talking after a lynch or deadline has elapsed until the mod posts to end the day. After that, you may not post even if the mod forgets to lock the thread.
C4) Night phases will last for 72 hours.
C5) In order to be accepted, night actions must be PMd to the mod or posted in bold in scum QTs before the deadline is up. If a player does not select one, he or she will default to "no action."
C6) If a replacement is needed during a night phase, I will extend the night deadline until some time after a replacement is found, regardless of whether that slot has a night action.
C7) Please treat this game as a commitment and do your best to participate actively.
C8) Players will be prodded after forty-eight hours without posting. They may also request prods on other players so long that player has not posted for a reasonable amount of time. All prods will be announced in thread.
C9) Players who do not respond to a (non-player-requested) prod within twenty-four hours or need to be prodded too often will be replaced at the discretion of the mod.
C10) If you will be unable to post for over forty-eight hours, inform the mod by PM or in the thread of when you'll be V/LA. Assuming the V/LA period is of reasonable length, you will be exempt from prods during that time. All V/LA notifications will be made public by the mod.
C11) I will try to post vote counts every page or every twenty-four hours if possible. Players may request a new vote count at any time.

D) Other

D1) Abilities follow Natural Action Resolution unless explicitly stated otherwise in your role PM.
D2) If there is a conflict between the rules and your role PM, the role PM takes precedence.
D3) Red is my color. You may not use it.
D4) Any methods of verifiable randomness are forbidden. This includes dice tags. Don't use them.
D5) It is possible something may have been overlooked or left unclear. When in doubt, ask. You may be punished for deliberately exploiting technicalities and vague wording in the rules in order to do something you should know is forbidden or unethical.
D6) Punishment for breaking any of the above rules may include a private or public warning, force replacement, modkill, or even blacklisting (depending on the seriousness of the offence).
D7) I will modkill players in the way most detrimental to their faction. Modkilled players may be retroactively made into Neutral Survivors.
D8) I reserve the right to add, remove, or modify rules at any point of the game if it becomes necessary.[/quote]
Role PMs sent out. Please confirm in the manner indicated in your PM. This game will start when 12 players have confirmed their role PMs (their names will be bolded in the player list)

Happy Chanukkah folks!

I kinda categorize people into archtypes

apathetic deep reader-people like tda they also lack the ability to pick up on emotional ques but stick close to the facts an d have some pretty good influence sometimes.

Emotional deep readers- put emotions into their reads are likely to get paranoid through they can pick up on emotional ques and figure stuff out faster-I am in this category and I think reinoe to.

emotional skimmers- easy to manipulate can throw games by missing vital things and the only positive I can think of is they are the votes that are good indicators of who has the most power.

Apathetic skimmers- less easy to manipulate but don't pick up on emotional ques and do tend to miss out on the most things things as they tend to go for the most logical steps even through mafia isn't about being logical most the time.

Spoiler: Picture


Zar's heart softened and let them continue their debate. Hanukkah, Christmas, Kwanzaa, New Years all have gone through before reaching a settlement for the first ID to check. But that won't stop the party. These people are here to stay celebrating.

Vincero seemed to everyone kinda sketchy... Come on, even he thought he was sketchy enough apparently. The ID was handed over to Zar, who took a glance and went over to his UV scan. Zar shook his head disappointedly and proceeded to address the rest of the excluded guests:

"Well, as you might know, the Epiphany is on January 6th. We were hoping to have 13 presents under the tree for you from the Three Wise Men, but it looks like I'll only need to worry about 12. I guess we'll repurpose whatever Vincero was going to get. Or do you want me to give him a consolation present anyway before I tell you whether or not he's an impostor?"

It took a while and some sneering (hopefully no more storm offs), but eventually everyone agreed to give him a pity gift.

"Alright then. Vincero, here's your gift."

Vincero received a modest white envelope from Zar. Once he opened it, he found a cruise to Neverland, without a return date on it!



"It is paid, vince. Thanks for visiting. You're good to go, though not allowed to go back to the party. In fact, the ticket doesn't have a return date because apparently, it's been decided you can't come back like, ever. So, enjoy your lifetime vacation from these premises. Don't worry about your luggage. We'll take care of it."

And so vincero left hopping joyfully on his holiday miracle. Man. sticking around apparently worked for him.

"Well, hello everyone! And Merry Christmas!"

"Wait... what? Wasn't that er... three weeks ago?"

"Zar??"

"Well, it was, but... Today is Orthodox Christmas!."

"Sooo, have you guys looked at our Christmas Tree?"

Spoiler: Tree


"Not only is it Orthodox Christmas, we also celebrate the epiphany because it's a MAJOR tradition at the Zar estate. So... go over to the tree, there are presents for all of you!"

All of you were amazed looking at the tree with all the gifts and the crimson tree skirt.

"Wait... wasn't the tree skirt white? Zar?"

"Why, yes. It is.. I haven't ordered any changes!" Zar then noticed a hand from under the tree, and then he saw the red was blood from a corpse.

"Oh man, so the impostors are definitely here! Oh come on! Get someone to clean this mess, quick! And no, don't get SnowStorm. He threw up over the carpet last time he had to clean the kitty litter... I don't want to know what would be of him cleaning after a dead body!"

"Okay whatever. The presents are here, I say we get to them anyway, right?"

Everyone nodded. They needed a distraction. Being locked up with criminals can be nerve-wracking... and if you're likely to die, maybe have some fun along the way, no? What's the harm?

That is the issue here: I do not know what your play is like in other games, but your play here has been bad/scummy, and you are getting punished for it.

That last sentence irks me because it has to be in-part true. Logical reasons to clear you aside, you are also being punished for poor play, no matter how good you are on good days. Your Day 1 here was not one of those good days. Garmr, should you legitimately be a 1-shot Hider, you played one outstandingly bad. Your softclaim was too much, your hardclaim came out in the midst of a bad altercation, your flares-up won you no patience with others, and you are trying to defend yourself with self-meta against a mix of emotional frustration and logic. Your current defense, Garmr, is not going to stop any push on you, but I also think any defense would fail, period.

geraintm has been lynched. scene coming shortly.

"Well, geraitm has had a sketchy behavior, indeed; we're fairly certain by now he has to be part of the evil ploy to ruin Zar's party."

Everyone was convinced of geraitm's guilt by now. It had to be his hat. Or maybe it was the fact he was the only of the guests who got a celebrity related present? Perhaps some envy had risen among the players?

Eventually, they all came up with the perfect plan to get rid of him. As geraitm was distracted by the shiny lights of the tree that was by now being dismantled, everyone piled on him, grabbing him and tying him up. Once they were convinced he could not move anymore, and after securing his wallet, they put him inside one of the boxes left to stow away the Christmas decorations. There was a roll of ribbon large enough to make a bow after the lid was properly secured. In addition, they had found some money inside the wallet, probably enough to pay for expedited shipping.

The end result was quite pleasing.

Spoiler: geraitm-in-a-box


Vincero would have no idea of what he was going to be expecting as a Secret Santa present! The excuse of delays in holiday shipping would have to do in the accompanying note.

When Zar came over to check on the gang he was pleased to find out they were sending a present to their exiled friend. He had heard vincero was doing quite well, but still figured he might be pleased with a sincere present... or was it?

Something ringed suspicious to Zar. (Cerainly not that a constant thumping came from the box... not at all!). He demanded some explanations, and eventually got everyone to confess what they had planned and got them to hand in the wallet. Some pocket money that could do to buy some of the items needed for V-day was going to be well received. Oh, and the ID was there anyway, so might as well scan it and see if vince was in for an unpleasant surprise...

Zar took a glimpse at the ID, scanned it. Smiled, and signed the waybill of the package. "Should be there in a couple of days," he said. "In the meantime, why don't you all take a rest?"

"But what about OUR presents? Demanded droog and Garmr. "We're the only ones that got nothing?!!"

"Oh. I almost forgot about that." Zar replied. "Well, here's yours droog, and here's yours Garmr."



"You can't be serious! This is exactly what we thought!" Both guests exclaimed.

"I know, right? I think you guys are mentally connected with the Wise Men, " Zar replied.

Spoiler: gift unwrapped


"Well," Zar said as he left, closing the door behind him, "have a good evening guys! Will you?"

Christmas celebrations had passed and gone, and so had the decorations that came with it. Zar had no idea if geraintm ever made it to vincero's side, but wasn't going to ask anyone about delivery confirmation. Christmas was just the beginning of many holiday celebrations that were to take place in the mansion. I mean, ZAR'S SCUMDAY had to be after all an event to remember. There would be Red Velvet Cake, to start. Why Red Velvet? That's not Zar's favorite cake, but it fits the mod and it lets Zar recycle some of the red props that were left from Christmas.

Zar was certain he was going to need amusement in the sketchy room too since part of his party was going to be spent by the guests there still trying to figuring out who was out to ruin the celebrations. He had an idea. She was going to be there, and probably knew what the songs where about, so... why not have her perform?

Spoiler: Take a Guess!


Well, she is probably NOT the real one, but there should be enough props available in the Castle to at least have her look the part. And it would probably be amusing for the other guests who had been pretty tense since the corpse appeared under the tree.

Much to Zar's demise though, it always seems he's one step behind here. For when he opened the hall, everyone was there, gathered around their latest encounter.

"Bummer", thought Zar. "Well, we can always borrow Faraday's sing-alongs for this room".

He shrugged as he proceded to call somebody to tend to the mess.

Titus has been lynched. Flip coming shortly.

The remaining guests had agreed on expelling Titus. They had a whole idea of what consisted in the sketchiest behavior of the room. Zar was happy he didn't have to open any more gifts because quite frankly he hadn't found a single one he would enjoy... well maybe the moustache guard because of the irony. Anyway, the remaining group members did push Titus to the front to be examined. Zar glanced at her, looked at the ID she provided. As he handed it back to the crowd he noticed a smear in his white trousers.

It was ink.

A lot of theories arose at the stain. It was maybe cheap giftwrap used by the guests, perhaps the ID had fallen onto something that could have caused it. Or maybe Zar's hands were dirty with something when he grabbed the ID. Matter of fact is, something had been awfully weird about that document and the UV ray was necessary to corroborate. But apparently that wasn't going to be needed because Titus quickly bolted out of the room through an open Window.

Nobody ever had time to tell her it was a fourth story drop from that side.


Titus, Mafia Role Cop, cornered into throwing herself from a fourth story window (lynched) on Day Three!

It is Now Night and it will last for Seventy Two (72) Hours.

Deadline: February 1, 2015 9:15 PM New York Time. (GMT+5)
Countdown to deadline: (expired on 2015-02-01 21:10:00)

The celebrations where nowhere finished in the Castle. Zar's scumday was indeed a large party, but with Valentines in the corner, red continued to fill the castle halls. The Christmas poinsettias had given into red sigils, but were now being replaced by the symbol of love.



And surely, among the many ways that love can be celebrated here, it can be familial, fraternal, passionate, platonic, a mod-crush, desire, admiration.

But sometimes, some people say and believe love hurts. Some of those even say love kills. That may not be true, though. I think it is a distortion of love, and over admiration maybe that twists into envy and resent, and which can only be satisfied when that which is desired is removed once and for all.

Or at least that was what the note said when in the morning we found the next missing guests remains, with a note saying "caught in a bad romance."

Pity.

Aeronaut has been lynched. Flip coming shortly

This had been a really weird Valentine setting. Love was supposed to be in the air everytime we looked around, but apparently love was the least of the interests in the secluded section where the 7 remaining sketchy guests roamed. In vain had Zar tried to get the impostors weeded out soon, 6 were already missing and a seventh one was to be picked from the remaining guests. Talk about love... there seemed to be only pure hatred left here.

Anyway, as a compensation for all the hurt feelings of the mod, and also to compensate the lack of the fake Madonna performance, it was decided that the cheesy pick of the guest being expelled would be heard first, if only to understand the mindset they were in. Maybe it would shed some light as to what we were encountering.

So after some deliberation, the majority decided Aeronaut was going to get to pick the next love song for the station. A melancholic air filled the atmosphere as Aeronaut, tired, head down moved to the phone and mumbled something to the Operator no one got to hear well. He then handed in his ID which Zar looked at, and then frowned.

As Zar's pick finished in the station, the DJ's voice was heard:

"And now Ladies and Gentlemen, we have a special request coming straight from the Castle's guests to 99.9 FM, LVRadio!"

And then, this tune started playing.

Aeronaut then said: "I guess that's all I have to say", and then started to run away, bolting through the door crying. But no one was sure if the tears were of sadness or lunacy. The song he chose though, made fairly clear what he had meant.


Aeronaut, Mafia Goon, forced to confess he was up to no good (lynched) on Day Four!

It is Now Night and it will last for Seventy Two (72) Hours.

Deadline: February 10, 2015 12:00 PM New York Time. (GMT+5)
Countdown to deadline: (expired on 2015-02-10 12:00:00)

With Valentines in the vicinity and the remaining true guests still trying to find out who was hiding in the dark, the swooning atmosphere Zar had hoped to achieve in the castle had turned into a melodramatic tune in the confinements of the sketchy guests. Aeronaut's Amy Winehouse rendition (which was surprisingly good, perhaps he could have even considered auditioning for the X-Factor --if he hadn't been a killer in disguise) had sent the remaining Six guest into a somber mood. It had worried 'Zar very much because he was afraid of what could happen during the night if left alone (heck, there was NO WAY he was going to stay babysitting these people, he had seen what they were capable of). So he left the premises hoping to not be given grim news.

The morning came, and with it, the somber dawn brought news from the secluded wing. Bitter love almost always leads to tragic endings. It's obsessive and toxic. And so it had happened. Now there were only five guests to worry about. On the upside, the castle was going to be reducing a bit its expenses on room and board. It would unfortunately not make for a very fun Mardi Gras preparation. But we would probably deal with that when the time comes. In the meantime, we'd be making the late guest a wreath out of the extra flowers not used as castle decoration for Valentines.

Thor has been lynched. Flip coming shortly.

Zar had concluded it was necessary to end the seclusion in the Eastern Tower. He was wasting too much of his time dealing with the sketchy people left.
So he had agreed to let them pick costumes from the boxes of leftover props still available, in case they had not managed to bring theirs when they first came.
These people were fairly inexperienced of how parties rolled in the Castle, anyway, so it was to be expected.

The costumes available were rather skimpy and revealing, but it was a tropical themed carnival and the Castle is well heated. Also, Zar had an idea that these would somehow make evident which of
the sketchy peeps was part of the ploy to bring the party down.

The first of the remaining guests to parade her costume through the hall was elle. She had picked a somewhat flamboyant, but rather well fitting fantasy Samba School Outfit.

Spoiler: elle's costume!
.

Since it didn't have any pockets, elle was forced to hand in over her ID.

Zar smiled. "It's okay" he said. "You can go to the party now. We'll forget all past transgressions. Party hard."

Elle felt relieved. She was either sick or tired of hanging out with the same people. "At least I'll share the fun!".

Then, it was SB's turn. He had obviouslt tried to pick something that could match elle's appealing costume. It seemed alright enough. A bit less revealing for someone so eager to carnival out, certainly, which Zar thought was odd.

Spoiler: SB's costume!


There was something in the outfit that just seemed off to Zar. The headpiece was too big, and it fit him kind of loose? He decided to card SB until he could inspect the last of the ID's.

Thor was the last to come out of the dressers. He had certainly tried to find something that wasn't too revealing, but it looked like he had failed to find anything fitting him. Particularly bothersome of his costume was the prop he accompanied his outfit with.
Spoiler: Thor's Costume!


So he confiscated Thor's card. Both looked relatively legit.

Zar was thus stuck with a dilemma, of whom to banish from the party. And called ellen to help him judge who was going to join her in the carnival.

Elle was a bit shocked at the picks. She was going to have to play fashion police here.

"So, elle. Tell me who you think is probably the conniving conspirationist against the Holiday Bash between these two?"

"I don't know." elle said. For one, it's like... that headpiece SB chose is probably large and loose enough to hide a bazooka in it. I think SB is hiding something. And then Thor maybe is trying to hide in the clear with that obvious weapon? This is confusing. WHY AM I STILL HERE I WANT TO PARTY!"

"Help me choose elle. I promise we'll make an event of it."

Elle's eyes narrowed, as she scrutinized every single terrible aspect of both outfits. In the end, she decided the stains in Thor's sword were probably not from tomato sauce.

"Hey!" Thor bickered. "Why can't elle hide a gun in her costume? Maybe she has an invisible lasso like Wonder Woman! Who knows! She should be here too."

"Because her ID passed the UV test." Zar responded. "You both took too long to come out so I ran it there while I waited, I just didn't say anything. Thor, I know you picked a Gladiator costume, so I've found a way to let you join the fun. How about we send you to the Lion den?"

I think the setup played well and in the end there was still a chance for the scum to win. A 1-Shot hider wouldn't have been too bad either; a Roleblocker wouldn't have interacted well with the Hider because NAR lets hide resolve first. For a second, the hider was almost wiped out, as Garmr was planning to Hide behind elle and Aeronaut almost NK'd elle's slot when he was considering killing Madonna. I was fairly demotivated to write flavor on day one until I decided to put up the baby sloth because the idea of having to keep constantly searching for replacements because some people simply abandoned the slots AFTER replacing in was a bit downbringing plus the few rule breachings and scream matches that this game spun around. As things calmed down, I got back on track writing some flavor for it.

I think town took a hit with the shenanigans of Day One and was fairly disorganized well into the end. To their advantage, Garmr's play with the hider let them organize themselves a little better. I think killing droog over TSO could've been a scum mistake. As far as design, I considered a Mafia Ascetic, but decided against it because it might have given the Mafia an unfair edge since it would have thrown in a misleading result for the hider. In addition, the hider had fairly big odds of "clearing" a mason or dying behind a goon, and the scum would have been given a double result if they targeted the hider's target, so all in all I do agree with it being balanced.

acfan was in the right track with his Role Hunting, I think they would have found TSO was a PR if they had checked him over serrapaladin.
I was honest in my opinions that I thought the setup was screwy and badly balanced. I consider a potential 4 town clears on Day 2 in a game of this size pretty terrible at face value.

Is it an extreme case?

Barring a choice to claim - a Hider played even half decently can get to the night phase.
If he draws a shot for looking town - it is pro-town.
If he hides behind town - it is pro-town.
If he hides behind scum - it is pro-town.
If he hides behind a Mason - it is arguably pro-scum in a loose way.

Basically, to avoid the situation you deem as extreme;
Scum have to shoot a Mason or the hide target and not shoot the Hider.
Hider has to target a Scum or Mason.

Functionally, town has two chances at achieving this - increasing their odds of it happening.
I think Hider is literally one of the most powerful town investigative roles in the game, and I also think Masons are one of the most potent roles in the game for pro-town play.
I'm pretty sure the math favors my 'extreme' possibility as happening more than 50% of the time - which...makes it not extreme.

But, let me maybe come at this in another direction - would you consider this same setup balanced if the role was not Hider, but a 2 shot Cop who was confirmed to not allow Godfathers to affect his ability and was investigation immune to the Rolecop?

I mean, just off the top of my head, but barring the Day 2 kill - was there a single day where scum didn't kill a confirmed town player?
Because that is not scum getting to kill who they want - that is scum trying to play catchup.
And that is why the setup is imbalanced.
Scum should have the right to control their kills - that is half the power of scum.

Day One? TDA wasn't killed for being a Mason, he was NK'd for being unlikely to be lynched.

The odds of the Hider hiding behind a VT slot on night one were about 50% objectively speaking; roughly 20% of hiding behind a mason, and a 30% of functioning like a weak Cop. These probabilities of the hider acting like a weak Cop increase slightly on Night 2, as do the odds of shooting the hider and a likely target.

I get that the Hider isn't liked by many players, but scum did have the power of choosing to get it removed if it was a nuissance rather than let him live and hope he would get lynched because of Garmr's fairly antitown play on day one. He outed himself as a hider on D1 and paraded the role; his likely D1 targets weren't impossible to discern either. If the Hider had dtayed hidden, not only were you given the ability to kill off a player, but your RoleCop gave you inside info on an possible unclaimed result you could use against the town.

In functionality, it feels to me, like serra says, as fairly similar to Friends and Enemies. A variant of this setup with a Mafia Ascetic thrown in the bunch could even work as an Open Setup.

In post 2030, Thor665 wrote:
In post 2025, Zar wrote:Day One? TDA wasn't killed for being a Mason, he was NK'd for being unlikely to be lynched.

Yes, and Night 1 was also a desperately fortuitous shot that barely kept scum in the game - albeit while dealing with the functionally BP mocking Cop.
Also, that's not what I asked - what I said was how many nights did scum kill non confirmed town? Functionally the Mason could have been confirmed at any point.

To clarify what I meant here - functionally the Mason role means that the instant you get it as your role what it says is 'scum has to NK this slot at some point - because it is a slot that cannot be lynched'

You handed scum two obligatory NKs.
And then a role that could become one itself and create a potential of two more in addition as well as being semi-BP.
So, at the end of Night 1, either a scum would be outed or town would have 2-4 obligatory kills for scum to make regardless of the relative quality of those players.

The effect of this on the scope of the game can be seen by the results of the kills - as I said, only 1 kill was functionally a free choice scum kill. All others were obligatory.
That's a tough bill of sale for a scum team. You might as well have less players and make it a nightless game or something at that point, in my opinion.

I will admit 'clears' are, in my opinion, the vastly most potent town effect in the game as they remove the whole 'uninformed' aspect from town and, consequently, batter away at scum's real benefit against being the minority. I actually prefer investigatives like watchers and trackers for that explicit reason. However, even for someone who thinks 'clears' are great, I submit there was far too much of that tech in this game.

Hi, I had fun. Thanks, Zar, for the moderation and flavor. Thanks, town, for carrying through to the end, and sorry, scum, for your tough odds.

With the Hider outed and telegraphing his targets, scum could have cleaned up better and taken the risk to do so. I feel that would have been a stronger move than their first two night kills, and could have been done either night. Hindsight, of course, is a fantastic position to make observations from.
